# üé∏ Bass ‚Äì follows root notes of each chord
# Lower octave for depth and darker tone

for note in [24, 28, 31, 24]:  # C2 ‚Üí E2 ‚Üí G2 ‚Üí C2 (1 octave lower)
    playNote(note, beats=4)

idata.author: Anonymous
idata.python:
# ü•Å Drums ‚Äì soft ambient groove (88 BPM)
# Kick = 36, Snare = 38, Hi-hat = 42

for i in range(8):
    playNote(42, beats=1)      # hi-hat every beat
    if i % 4 == 0:
        playNote(36, beats=0.5)  # kick on beat 1
    if i % 8 == 2:
        playNote(38, beats=0.5)  # snare on beat 3

# Drum rhythm created using modulo operator for timing
# Example logic adapted from Van Schooneveld (n.d.), Real Python:
# https://realpython.com/python-modulo-operator/

idata.author: Anonymous
idata.python:
# üéπ Radiohead ‚Äì All I Need (Instrumental to Outro)
# Keyboard / Chord layer (no wait(), just natural overlap)

# Chord 1: C major (C‚ÄìE‚ÄìG)
playNote(48, beats=4)
playNote(52, beats=4)
playNote(55, beats=4)
# Repeat for sustain
playNote(48, beats=4)
playNote(52, beats=4)
playNote(55, beats=4)

# Chord 2: E minor (E‚ÄìG‚ÄìB)
playNote(52, beats=4)
playNote(55, beats=4)
playNote(59, beats=4)
playNote(52, beats=4)
playNote(55, beats=4)
playNote(59, beats=4)

# Chord 3: G major (G‚ÄìB‚ÄìD)
playNote(55, beats=4)
playNote(59, beats=4)
playNote(62, beats=4)
playNote(55, beats=4)
playNote(59, beats=4)
playNote(62, beats=4)

# Chord 4: C major (resolve)
playNote(48, beats=4)
playNote(52, beats=4)
playNote(55, beats=4)
playNote(48, beats=4)
playNote(52, beats=4)
playNote(55, beats=4)

# Built using TunePad's playNote() function
# Reference: TunePad (n.d.). Learn TunePad tutorials. https://tunepad.com

idata.author: Anonymous
idata.python:
# üéπ Radiohead ‚Äì All I Need (Lead / Melody line)
# Instrument: Keyboard (Piano)
# This creates the emotional floating melody that sits on top of the chords.

# Section 1 ‚Äì gentle lift over C ‚Üí Em
# Higher octave (C5‚ÄìE5 range) for an airy tone
playNote(60, beats=2)   # C5
playNote(62, beats=2)   # D5
playNote(64, beats=2)   # E5
playNote(62, beats=2)   # D5
playNote(60, beats=4)   # Hold C5 (soft resolve)

# Section 2 ‚Äì expressive variation over G ‚Üí C
# Mimics the feel of the vocals
playNote(76, beats=2)   # E5
playNote(79, beats=2)   # G5
playNote(77, beats=2)   # F5
playNote(76, beats=2)   # E5
playNote(72, beats=4)   # Final C5 ‚Äì resolves to tonic

# Simple repeating melody built from MIDI note values
# Experimented with timing using for loops and beats for emotional pacing
# Reference: Horn, West, & Roberts (2022). *Learning Music with Code.* MIT Press.
